newsitem.title: JAPAN: Digicube says robust demand for new game software.
newsitem.headline: Digicube says robust demand for new game software.

text.p: Digicube Co Ltd, a subsidiary of Japanese game software firm Square Co Ltd, said on Monday that orders for Square's new game software "Final Fantasy VII" at convenience stores in Japan reached 1.15 million units as of January 18.
Digicube said in a statement that it began accepting orders at five convenience store chains in Japan on December 1, 1996.
Encouraged by the robust orders, the company has placed an order with Square for 2.2 million units of the new game, the statement said.
The new title is only compatible with Sony Computer Entertainment's PlayStation game machine.
Digicube was set up in March 1996 to market videogame software in convenience stores.
